briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of Azelaic Acid Foam, 15 % in Papulopustular Rosacea
officialTitle: A Randomized, Double-blind, Vehicle-controlled, Multicenter, Parallel-group Clinical Trial to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of Azelaic Acid Foam, 15% Topically Applied Twice Daily for 12 Weeks in Subjects With Papulopustular Rosacea
summary: The purpose of this study is to assess the safety and efficacy of azelaic acid (AzA) foam, 15% topically applied twice daily for 12 weeks in subjects with papulopustular rosacea compared to its vehicle.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Investigator's Global Assessment (IGA) Based Therapeutic Success at End of Treatment (LOCF: Last Observation Carried Forward)
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: At end of treatment (LOCF), up to 12 weeks
